misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that trip cost is computed by first finding gallons used (distance ÷ miles-per-gallon) and then multiplying by price per gallon, and that reading doubles with Scanner will preserve decimals.

misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that trip cost is computed as (distance ÷ milesPerGallon) × pricePerGallon, and that reading three doubles from the user and printing the computed double will satisfy the required output.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap detected. Java evaluates the expression left-to-right with doubles, so division and multiplication are done in floating-point as intended; input is read in the correct order; output matches the required message format (aside from acceptable numeric formatting differences).
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No bug; produces correct numeric result for the sample inputs (prints approximately 34.297872340425535).
